Email Conversation Export
=========================
Export Date: 2025-09-26 12:09:29
Folder: CS0SVDS - rfq - political violence insurance renewal - offer analysis and recommendation
Message Count: 3

--------------------------------------------------
ID: CS0SVDS_00
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>
CC: 
BCC: 
Date: 2024-09-26 14:06
Subject: RFQ - Political Violence Insurance Renewal - Offer Analysis and Recommendation
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Joe,

 

I hope you’re doing well.

 

As part of our efforts to secure comprehensive Political Violence (PV) insurance for the group, we solicited quotes from Nasco, AON, and Marsh. After reviewing their proposals, I’d like to present a summary of the results for your approval.

 

Process:

*	We requested quotes based on identical coverage terms to ensure direct comparability and maintain our existing level of cover.
*	To inspire trust, ensure transparency, and avoid prolonged negotiations, participants were asked to submit their best and final offers by 25/09/2024, with an award decision set for 27/09/2024.

 

Coverage Highlights:

*	Perils Covered:              Acts of Terrorism, Sabotage, Strikes, Riots, Civil Commotion, War, and Civil War
*	Insured Regions:          UAE, KSA, Kuwait, Qatar, Bahrain, Egypt, and Jordan
*	Insured Value:                USD 1.25 billion
*	Limit of Indemnity:      USD 50 million per occurrence and in aggregate, covering both Property Damage and Business Interruption.

 

Offer Comparison:

Presented Offers

Premium (+ VAT)

metadata.doc_id: CS0SVDS - rfq - political violence insurance renewal - offer analysis and recommendation\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CS0SVDS - rfq - political violence insurance renewal - offer analysis and recommendation\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
Premium (+ VAT)

Net Reduction

Base Premium 

USD 98,175

-

Nasco

USD 78,540

USD 19,635 (80%)

AON

USD 78,913

USD 19,262 (80%)

Marsh

USD 66,150

USD 32,025 (67%)

 

Recommendation:

While all offers provide identical coverage, Marsh presents the most competitive premium at USD 66,150, representing a significant reduction from the base premium.

 

There may be some pushback from Nasco, but with a USD 13,000 difference between Marsh and the next best offer, the decision is well justified.

 

Moreover, awarding the contract to Marsh will foster competition for next year’s tender and encourage them to focus on the cyber insurance proposal, in which they are particularly strong.

 

Please confirm if you're aligned with this direction. I’ve enclosed the final quotations for your reference and am available for any clarification required.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​	
SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION	
M.C.T. FZE	
DUBAI

Date: 2024-09-26 14:40
Subject: RE: RFQ - Political Violence Insurance Renewal - Offer Analysis and Recommendation
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Joe,

 

The Nasco team called just now and gave a final revised offer of USD 68,250.

 

This complicates the situation a bit.

 

We have two options:

 

*	We request Nasco to match the Marsh offer and take it but we lose a bit of credibility with Marsh
*	We proceed to award the contract to Marsh but Nasco will cause a bit of headache

 

I’m fine with either direction. Do you have any thoughts?

 

We have until tomorrow to make a decision.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

Hi Joe,

 

The Nasco team called just now and gave a final revised offer of USD 68,250.

 

This complicates the situation a bit.

 

We have two options:

 

*	We request Nasco to match the Marsh offer and take it but we lose a bit of credibility with Marsh
*	We proceed to award the contract to Marsh but Nasco will cause a bit of headache

 

I’m fine with either direction. Do you have any thoughts?

 

We have until tomorrow to make a decision.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop
